free_text.Learning outcomes: The course aims at providing students with key references from futures studies and challenging cases and issues to reflect upon, for both acquiring a first hand, state-of-the-art knowledge in the domain (coping with uncertain futures) and develop concrete analytical capabilities through various interactive in-class execices as well as more in-depth team exercises to be carried out during the week and to be presented the final day.[br/][br/]The goal is ultimately to develop a systematic understanding of how firms and organizations anticipate, maintain their perfomative strengths (optimise their sense of resillience and serendipity), manage to keep being proactive in terms of technological innovative initiatives and stlly, comply with regulatory requirements or societal changes if needed
free_text.Content: Setting the objectives and working mode[br/]Overview of Technology foresight and key issues, assignments[br/]Futures studies methods:getting oriented in the monitoring, the forecasting, the creative and the early detection approaches[br/]From competitive to responsible futures: peculiarities of technology-oriented corporate foresight[br/]Policy-related foresight[br/]Key innovation developments as case explorations: challenges and options[br/]Exercise presentations: 1) technology-based strategy design, 2) networking for innovation 3) beyond the intellectual property barrier: the realm of blue oceans and open innovation biases, 4) Knowledge management issues[br/]Towards a robust strategic intelligence package for MoT/MoI[br/]
free_text.Keywords: Technology assessment, foresight, strategic intelligence, enviromental scanning, early detection, disruptive futures, weak signals, wild cards, business wargaming
